name: Shab-e She’r (Poetry Night) CXI
description:
Shab-e She’r (Poetry Night) is Canada’s most diverse and brave open mic poetry reading series. 

Featuring poets Anna Yin and Jovan Shadd, with an open mic opportunity for poetry in any language. Hosted by Bänoo Zan.

name: Toronto Newcomer Day
description:
Join us in welcoming and celebrating newcomers at Nathan Phillips Square. Now in its 11th year, Toronto Newcomer Day provides a fun way for newcomers to learn how to get set up in their new city while enjoying festivities that showcase Toronto’s diversity. The event features cultural performances, children’s activities, a food fair and marketplace, tours of City Hall (by pre-registration), a citizenship ceremony and more than 100 information booths.

Share your day with #ToNewcomerDay

name: Queer Toronto and the Austins: Layers of History in the 1920s and 30s at Spadina Museum
description: Ever wanted to know more about Queer Toronto history? During Pride month, Spadina Museum is enriching their free guided tours with 2SLGBTQIA+  histories. Telling the story of the Austin family in the 1920s and 30s who lived in the magnificent house atop the hill, Spadina Museum’s tours will also showcase the lives of Queer people who lived in Toronto during the same period. A showcase of dresses and artefacts from Michelle DuBarry, one of Canada’s oldest drag queens, will be on display as part of the tour.

name: Storytelling Circle at Montgomery's Inn
description:
Join our Storytelling Circle at Montgomery's Inn! 

This Storytelling Circle is a welcoming and relaxing environment designed to make everyone feel safe to share our stories. Participants will gather in a circle to listen to the stories from different oral traditions, as well as share their favourite stories! 

Participants will be guided by our principal storyteller Maria Ordonez, who will invite them to share, create, improvise and retell their own stories. Stories will change according to monthly themes - so there will always be new stories to hear and share! 

This program also takes place during Montgomery's Inn's weekly Farmer's Market.

name: Pup Quiz! Dog-Friendly Trivia at Black Lab Brewing
description:
Enjoy classic categories like music and pop culture and one-of-a-kind categories like portmanteaus and match the bark to the breed! Pup Quiz is about having fun. And with ample treats and prizes, everyone's a winner.

Accessibility notes - there are a couple of steps to enter the brewery from the front, but a back door at street level that can be used. Just let us know and we can make sure there is someone there to help you. Washrooms are the same level as the event space.

name: Snacks & Science: Women and Stroke
description:
Stroke isn’t the same for everyone—join us to explore the unique risks, symptoms, and recovery challenges women face.

Join Dr. Ada Tang and Dr. Kevin Moncion for a presentation of sex and gender risk factors for stroke, including how stroke presents differently in women and what you can do to recognize stroke and reduce your risk.

Topics covered will include:

How do women experience stroke differently?
What are the risk factors for stroke in women?
What can women do to decrease their risk of stroke?
How does our research help us understand stroke?
A question and answer period and open discussion will follow!

name: Tao Wellness - The Way for Healthier Living

location.name: Master Sha Wellness Centre - virtual event

description:
Step into the powerful Tao Calligraphy Field with beloved Master Teachers. Receive deep healing, spiritual wisdom, and live blessings to transform pain into peace and struggle into strength.
Join us in this sacred space, live inside the Master Sha Tao Software. Create an account or log in and find it under the Events tab on our website.

name: Thistletown Streets Plan Public Drop-In Event
description: The City is developing a Neighbourhood Streets Plan (NSP) for the Thistletown area that identifies, prioritizes and recommends short and long-term improvements to traffic operations and road design to support safety for all modes of transportation. The plan aims to address four main areas of concern: road safety for vulnerable road users (e.g. pedestrians, children, older adults and people cycling), excessive speeding, excessive motor vehicle traffic on local streets and opportunities for active transportation.

name: Wednesday Night Folk Cabaret Orchestral Pop with Ronley Teper & The Lipliners
description: Ronley Teper is most known for her genre-blending unabashed, experimental live performances, alongside her rotating collective of improvisors known as The Lipliners. A mix of folk, singer/songwriter, jazz, funk, orchestral pop, post rock, cabaret, and the blues. Every tool in the kit is used to craft whimsical, surreal, and engaging contemporary art through music.  It’s an approach free of inhibition that hearkens to the experimenter's like Zappa or Waits.

name: Taste the Legacy with Wines of Portugal
description:
Come and discover the uniqueness and diversity of Portugal's vineyards at this wine tasting event! Enjoy appetizers, music and some surprises throughout the night.

The many regions, grape varieties and winemaking styles of over 24 Portuguese wine producers will be showcased in a unique evening. The Portuguese producers have travelled a long way to bring the taste of their vineyards to you!

You'll have the chance to taste over 200 wines available at the LCBO and private imports, as well as wines never before offered on the Ontario market.

Spend time with friends, make it a date night or come as you are and get the spring off to a great start!
